the-background-attachment.name: background-attachment
the-background-attachment.summary: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether a background image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls with its containing block.
the-background-attachment.title: background-attachment

the-background-clip.name: background-clip
the-background-clip.summary: The background-clip CSS property sets whether an element's background extends underneath its border box, padding box, or content box.

chrome.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

chrome_android.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

ie.notes: In IE 7 and IE 8 of Internet Explorer, this property always behaved like background-clip: padding when overflow was hidden, auto, or scroll.

opera.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

opera_android.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari.notes: Safari accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari_ios.notes: Safari accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

webview_android.notes: WebView accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

edge_blink.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

the-background-clip.title: background-clip

background-color.name: background-color
background-color.summary: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 8 and 9, there is a bug where a computed background-color of transparent causes click events to not get fired on overlaid elements.

background-color.title: background-color

background-image.name: background-image
background-image.summary: The background-image CSS property sets one or more background images on an element.

firefox.notes: If the browser.display.use_document_colors user preference in about:config is set to false, background images will not be displayed.

firefox_android.notes: If the browser.display.use_document_colors user preference in about:config is set to false, background images will not be displayed.

background-image.title: background-image

the-background-origin.name: background-origin
the-background-origin.summary: The background-origin CSS property sets the background's origin: from the border start, inside the border, or inside the padding.

chrome.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

chrome_android.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

ie.notes: In IE 7 and before, Internet explorer was behaving as if background-origin: border-box was set. In Internet Explorer 8, as if background-origin: padding-box, the regular default value, was set.

opera.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

opera_android.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari.notes: Webkit accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari_ios.notes: Webkit accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

webview_android.notes: WebView accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

edge_blink.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

the-background-origin.title: background-origin

background-position.name: background-position
background-position.summary: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin.
background-position.title: background-position

the-background-repeat.name: background-repeat
the-background-repeat.summary: The background-repeat CSS property sets how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal and vertical axes, or not repeated at all.
the-background-repeat.title: background-repeat

the-background-size.name: background-size
the-background-size.summary: The background-size CSS property sets the size of the element's background image. The image can be left to its natural size, stretched, or constrained to fit the available space.

chrome.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

chrome_android.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

opera.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

Opera 9.5's computation of the background positioning area is incorrect for fixed backgrounds. Opera 9.5 also interprets the two-value form as a horizontal scaling factor and, from appearances, a vertical clipping dimension. This has been fixed in Opera 10.

opera_android.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

Opera 9.5's computation of the background positioning area is incorrect for fixed backgrounds. Opera 9.5 also interprets the two-value form as a horizontal scaling factor and, from appearances, a vertical clipping dimension. This has been fixed in Opera 10.

safari.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

safari_ios.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

samsunginternet_android.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

webview_android.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

edge_blink.notes: WebKit-based browsers originally implemented an older draft of CSS3 background-size in which an omitted second value is treated as duplicating the first value; this draft does not include the contain or cover keywords.

the-background-size.title: background-size

the-background.name: background
the-background.summary: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.
the-background.title: background

propdef-border-bottom-color.name: border-bottom-color
propdef-border-bottom-color.summary: The border-bottom-color CSS property sets the color of an element's bottom border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-bottom-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-bottom-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

propdef-border-bottom-color.title: border-bottom-color

propdef-border-bottom-left-radius.name: border-bottom-left-radius
propdef-border-bottom-left-radius.summary: The border-bottom-left-radius CSS property rounds the bottom-left corner of an element.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

propdef-border-bottom-left-radius.title: border-bottom-left-radius

propdef-border-bottom-right-radius.name: border-bottom-right-radius
propdef-border-bottom-right-radius.summary: The border-bottom-right-radius CSS property rounds the bottom-right corner of an element.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

propdef-border-bottom-right-radius.title: border-bottom-right-radius

propdef-border-bottom-style.name: border-bottom-style
propdef-border-bottom-style.summary: The border-bottom-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's bottom border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

propdef-border-bottom-style.title: border-bottom-style

the-border-width.name: border-bottom-width
the-border-width.summary: The border-bottom-width CSS property sets the width of the bottom border of an element.
the-border-width.title: border-bottom-width

the-border-width.name: border-left-width
the-border-width.summary: The border-left-width CSS property sets the width of the left border of an element.
the-border-width.title: border-left-width

the-border-width.name: border-right-width
the-border-width.summary: The border-right-width CSS property sets the width of the right border of an element.
the-border-width.title: border-right-width

the-border-width.name: border-top-width
the-border-width.summary: The border-top-width CSS property sets the width of the top border of an element.
the-border-width.title: border-top-width

the-border-width.name: border-width
the-border-width.summary: The border-width shorthand CSS property sets the width of an element's border.
the-border-width.title: border-width

propdef-border-bottom.name: border-bottom
propdef-border-bottom.summary: The border-bottom shorthand CSS property sets an element's bottom border.
propdef-border-bottom.title: border-bottom

border-color.name: border-color
border-color.summary: The border-color shorthand CSS property sets the color of an element's border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

border-color.title: border-color

the-border-image-outset.name: border-image-outset
the-border-image-outset.summary: The border-image-outset CSS property sets the distance by which an element's border image is set out from its border box.
the-border-image-outset.title: border-image-outset

the-border-image-repeat.name: border-image-repeat
the-border-image-repeat.summary: The border-image-repeat CSS property defines how the edge regions of a source image are adjusted to fit the dimensions of an element's border image.
the-border-image-repeat.title: border-image-repeat

the-border-image-slice.name: border-image-slice
the-border-image-slice.summary: The border-image-slice CSS property divides the image specified by border-image-source into regions. These regions form the components of an element's border image.

notes: Small SVGs are incorrectly stretched, because percentages in border-image-slice are computed to integers instead of floats (bug 1284797).
Until Firefox 47, SVGs without viewport were not sliced correctly (bug 619500).
From Firefox 48 until Firefox 49, SVGs without viewport are displayed the same as SVGs with viewport, but if the slices are not exactly 50%, they are incorrectly stretched (bug 1264809).
Until Firefox 57, an issue persisted for SVGs without viewport when e10s was disabled (bug 1290782).
Small SVGs are incorrectly stretched, because percentages in border-image-slice are computed to integers instead of floats (bug 1284797).
Until Firefox 47, SVGs without viewport were not sliced correctly (bug 619500).
From Firefox 48 until Firefox 49, SVGs without viewport are displayed the same as SVGs with viewport, but if the slices are not exactly 50%, they are incorrectly stretched (bug 1264809).
Until Firefox 57, an issue persisted for SVGs without viewport when e10s was disabled (bug 1290782).

the-border-image-slice.title: border-image-slice

the-border-image-source.name: border-image-source
the-border-image-source.summary: The border-image-source CSS property sets the source image used to create an element's border image.
the-border-image-source.title: border-image-source

the-border-image-width.name: border-image-width
the-border-image-width.summary: The border-image-width CSS property sets the width of an element's border image.
the-border-image-width.title: border-image-width

the-border-image.name: border-image
the-border-image.summary: The border-image CSS property draws an image around a given element. It replaces the element's regular border.

notes: Small SVGs are incorrectly stretched, because percentages in border-image-slice are computed to integers instead of floats (bug 1284797).
Until Firefox 47, SVGs without viewport were not sliced correctly (bug 619500).
From Firefox 48 until Firefox 49, SVGs without viewport are displayed the same as SVGs with viewport, but if the slices are not exactly 50%, they are incorrectly stretched (bug 1264809).
Until Firefox 57, an issue persisted for SVGs without viewport when e10s was disabled (bug 1290782).

firefox.notes: An earlier version of the specification was implemented, prefixed, in Firefox versions prior to 15.

notes: Small SVGs are incorrectly stretched, because percentages in border-image-slice are computed to integers instead of floats (bug 1284797).
Until Firefox 47, SVGs without viewport were not sliced correctly (bug 619500).
From Firefox 48 until Firefox 49, SVGs without viewport are displayed the same as SVGs with viewport, but if the slices are not exactly 50%, they are incorrectly stretched (bug 1264809).
Until Firefox 57, an issue persisted for SVGs without viewport when e10s was disabled (bug 1290782).

firefox_android.notes: An earlier version of the specification was implemented, prefixed, in Firefox versions prior to 15.

the-border-image.title: border-image

propdef-border-left-color.name: border-left-color
propdef-border-left-color.summary: The border-left-color CSS property sets the color of an element's left border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-left-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-left-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

propdef-border-left-color.title: border-left-color

the-border-style.name: border-left-style
the-border-style.summary: The border-left-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's left border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

the-border-style.title: border-left-style

the-border-style.name: border-right-style
the-border-style.summary: The border-right-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's right border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

the-border-style.title: border-right-style

the-border-style.name: border-top-style
the-border-style.summary: The border-top-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's top border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-top-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-top-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

the-border-style.title: border-top-style

propdef-border-left.name: border-left
propdef-border-left.summary: The border-left shorthand CSS property set an element's left border.
propdef-border-left.title: border-left

border-radius.name: border-radius
border-radius.summary: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

chrome.notes: Chrome ignores border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate value.

notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

To conform to the CSS3 standard, Firefox 4 changes the handling of <percentage> values to match the specification. You can specify an ellipse as a border on an arbitrary sized element with border-radius: 50%;. Firefox 4 also makes rounded corners clip content and images if overflow: visible is not set.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

opera.notes: Before Opera 11.60, replaced elements with border-radius do not have rounded corners.

safari.notes: Safari ignores border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate value.

safari_ios.notes: Safari ignores border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate value.

edge_blink.notes: Chrome ignores border-radius on <select> elements unless -webkit-appearance is overridden to an appropriate value.

border-radius.title: border-radius

propdef-border-right-color.name: border-right-color
propdef-border-right-color.summary: The border-right-color CSS property sets the color of an element's right border. It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-right.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-right-colors CSS property that sets the right border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-right-colors CSS property that sets the right border to multiple colors.

propdef-border-right-color.title: border-right-color

propdef-border-right.name: border-right
propdef-border-right.summary: The border-right shorthand CSS property sets the properties of an element's right border.
propdef-border-right.title: border-right

border-style.name: border-style
border-style.summary: The border-style shorthand CSS property sets the line style for all four sides of an element's border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

border-style.title: border-style

propdef-border-top-color.name: border-top-color
propdef-border-top-color.summary: The border-top-color CSS property sets the color of an element's top border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-top-colors CSS property that sets the top border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-top-colors CSS property that sets the top border to multiple colors.

propdef-border-top-color.title: border-top-color

the-border-radius.name: border-top-left-radius
the-border-radius.summary: The border-top-left-radius CSS property rounds the top-left corner of an element by specifying the radius (or the radius of the semi-major and semi-minor axes) of the ellipse defining the curvature of the corner.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

the-border-radius.title: border-top-left-radius

the-border-radius.name: border-top-right-radius
the-border-radius.summary: The border-top-right-radius CSS property rounds the top-right corner of an element by specifying the radius (or the radius of the semi-major and semi-minor axes) of the ellipse defining the curvature of the corner.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners were always rendered as if border-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

the-border-radius.title: border-top-right-radius

propdef-border-top.name: border-top
propdef-border-top.summary: The border-top shorthand CSS property sets all the properties of an element's top border.
propdef-border-top.title: border-top

the-border-shorthands.name: border
the-border-shorthands.summary: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border.
the-border-shorthands.title: border

box-shadow.name: box-shadow
box-shadow.summary: The box-shadow CSS property adds shadow effects around an element's frame. You can set multiple effects separated by commas.

chrome.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

chrome_android.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

firefox.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

firefox_android.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

notes: To use box-shadow in Internet Explorer 9 or later, you must set border-collapse to separate.

Since version 5.5, Internet Explorer supports Microsoft's DropShadow and Shadow Filter. You can use this proprietary extension to cast a drop shadow (though the syntax and the effect are different from CSS3)

opera.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

opera_android.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

safari.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

safari_ios.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

webview_android.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

edge_blink.notes: Shadows affect layout in this browser. For example, if you cast an outer shadow to a box with a width of 100%, then you'll see a scrollbar.

box-shadow.title: box-shadow

typedef-bg-position.name: position
typedef-bg-position.summary: The <position> (or <bg-position>) CSS data type denotes a two-dimensional coordinate used to set a location relative to an element box. It is used in the background-position and offset-anchor properties.
typedef-bg-position.title: <position>
